tables.Normal Dose (CrCl >60 mL/min): 15-20 mg/kg IV every 8-12 hours (target trough 10-20 mcg/mL for serious infections)
tables.Renal Adjustment Examples: - CrCl 30-60: 10-15 mg/kg every 12-24 hours- CrCl 10-30: 10 mg/kg every 24-48 hours- CrCl <10: 10 mg/kg every 48-72 hours or based on levelsMonitor trough levels closely to avoid nephrotoxicity.

tables.Normal Dose (CrCl >60 mL/min): 5-7 mg/kg IV once daily (extended-interval) or 1-2 mg/kg every 8 hours (traditional)
tables.Renal Adjustment Examples: - CrCl 40-60: 3-5 mg/kg every 24-36 hours- CrCl 20-40: 2-3 mg/kg every 36-48 hours- CrCl <20: Load 2 mg/kg, then based on levels (trough <1 mcg/mL)Peak/trough monitoring essential.

tables.Normal Dose (CrCl >60 mL/min): Similar to gentamicin: 5-7 mg/kg IV once daily
tables.Renal Adjustment Examples: - CrCl 40-60: 4-5 mg/kg every 24-36 hours- CrCl 20-40: 3-4 mg/kg every 36-48 hours- CrCl <20: Load 2 mg/kg, then per levelsAdjust for cystic fibrosis or other indications.

- CrCl 40-60: 10-12 mg/kg every 24-36 hours- CrCl 20-40: 7.5-10 mg/kg every 36-48 hours- CrCl <20: Load 7.5 mg/kg, then based on levels (trough <4-8 mcg/mL)Higher risk of ototoxicity; monitor closely.

tables.Normal Dose (CrCl >60 mL/min): 400 mg IV every 12 hours or 500-750 mg PO every 12 hours
tables.Renal Adjustment Examples: - CrCl 30-50: No change or extend to every 18-24 hours- CrCl <30: 400 mg IV every 24 hours or 250-500 mg PO every 24 hoursNot dialyzable; adjust for UTI vs. systemic use.
- CrCl 20-50: 500-750 mg every 48 hours (or half dose daily)- CrCl <20: 250-500 mg every 48 hours (load with full dose)Monitor for QT prolongation in renal impairment.
- CrCl 30-60: 1-2 g every 12 hours- CrCl 11-29: 1-2 g every 24 hours- CrCl <11: 0.5-1 g every 24 hoursIncrease for Pseudomonas infections.
- CrCl 31-50: 1-2 g every 12 hours- CrCl 16-30: 1 g every 24 hours- CrCl <15: 0.5 g every 24 hoursUsed for gram-negative coverage.
- CrCl 20-40: 3.375 g every 8 hours- CrCl <20: 2.25 g every 8 hours (or every 12 hours for severe impairment)Extended infusion may be used for optimization.
- CrCl 26-50: 1 g every 12 hours- CrCl 10-25: 0.5 g every 12 hours- CrCl <10: 0.5 g every 24 hoursShort half-life; adjust for CNS infections.
- CrCl 25-50: Every 12 hours- CrCl 10-25: Every 24 hours (half dose)- CrCl <10: 2.5-5 mg/kg every 24 hoursPO doses also adjusted; hydrate to prevent crystalluria.
